alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 4:44AM EST until January 19 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Fairfield, Lancaster and Kershaw Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Lexington, Calhoun and Richland Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wateree River at Lake Wateree. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 100.4 feet, The piers on the Wildlife Road bridge over Singleton Creek become submerged. At 102.5 feet, Roadways near Beaver Creek become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 101.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 100.0 feet. - R - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 94.0 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 100.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued early this morning at 545 AM EST.
